meanings.definition: Mislights (verb): to illuminate incorrectly or inadequately
meanings.sent1: She mislights the room by placing the lamp in the wrong corner.
meanings.sent2: The dim flashlight mislights the path ahead, making it hard to see.
meanings.sent3: The mislights in the haunted house made the ghost look like a friendly shadow.
meanings.sent4: The mislights of the city at night create a surreal atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The mislights of the stage added a mysterious aura to the performance.

meanings.sent1: The mislights in the hallway cast strange shadows on the walls.
meanings.sent2: The theater suffered from mislights during the play, causing confusion among the actors.
meanings.sent3: The mislights in the museum made the paintings appear blurry.
meanings.sent4: The mislights of the street lamps gave the neighborhood an eerie feel.
meanings.sent5: The mislights of the party venue created a cozy ambiance.

meanings.sent1: The mislights room seemed smaller due to the lack of proper lighting.
meanings.sent2: The mislights path in the forest made it challenging to navigate at night.
meanings.sent3: The mislights cake looked unappetizing under the dull glow.
meanings.sent4: The mislights sky during the storm added to the ominous atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The mislights garden appeared mysterious in the moonlight.
